result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason L. Wright

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea Hearing 8/8/16
Cover Letter from Court
Cover Letter from Court
notice of assignment of judge

Defendant Jason L. Wright in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Defendant Jason L. Wright in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  State states agreement as to 15CF366 - amended information filed.  DE to plead NC to Ct 3 amended to include dangerous weapon enhancer.  State would then move to dismiss/read-in counts 1 and 2 and 16CF55 in it's entirety.  PSI to be requested w/argued plea/sentencing.  Atty Frank is in agreement.  DE also agrees.  Parties discuss how the dangerous weapon enhancer would affect possible penalties.  State moves to amend information.  Atty Frank agrees.  Court grants State's motion to amend by filing second amended information.  Atty Frank enters NC plea to count 3.  Court questions DE as to NC plea to count 3.  Court advises DE re: voting rights/felony firearms warnings.  State has complied w/victim's rights statutes.  Notes stitches not mentioned in complaint/information.  Atty Frank will stipulate to factual basis.  Court accepts plea and finds DE guilty.  State will provide VIS at sentencing.  Court dismisses counts 1 and 2 of 15CF366 and 16CF55 in it's entirety.  Court orders PSI.  That to be completed not later than 9/30/2016.  Bond continues pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on August 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Plea hearing on August 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jason L. Wright in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Defendant Jason L. Wright in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Frank talked with PD's office and would not appoint another atty.  Court rescinded withdrawal of atty. Frank so Atty. Frank is still atty. of record.  DE concurs.  Atty. Frank states parties are ready to go.  Court states trial still on.

Status conference on April 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jason L. Wright appeared by video means. Prosecuting Linda Hoffman appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Frank withdrew based on PD office appointing new counsel.  After today's discussions with PD office, they will not be reappointing counsel.  Defendant was not aware of that information.  Defendant request counsel.  Court sets out 3 weeks for defendant to contact Attorney Frank.  Court rescinds order withdrawing Attorney Frank.  State does not object.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jason L. Wright in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Defendant Jason L. Wright in custody.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Frank advises of waiver today.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.
Preliminary hearing at 02-26-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Jason L. Wright by video from LEC with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Jason L. Wright in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Tsai responds/believes atty Mark Frank will be counsel.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived.  $100.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No violent contact w/anyone.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.
